titleStmt.title: A speech made to his Excellency the Lord General Monck, and the Councell of State, at Drapers-Hall in London the 28th of March, 1660. At which time they were entertained by that honourable Company.
titleStmt.author: Yolkney, Walter.
Jordan, Thomas, 1612?-1685?, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Henry Broome at the Gun in Ivy-lane,

notesStmt.note: At end: Spoken by Walter Yeokney. The reader may take notice that the other speech is a forged cheat, and disowned by Walter Yeokney.
Attributed by Wing to Thomas Jordan.
Verse - "Most honoured Sir, if a poore Schollar may".
Reproduction of the originals in the British Library.
